details:
Two vulnerabilities were discovered in SQLALchemy, a Python SQL
Toolkit and Object Relational Mapper.


* [CVE-2019-7164](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-7164)
SQLAlchemy allows SQL Injection via the order\_by parameter.
* [CVE-2019-7548](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-7548)
SQLAlchemy has SQL Injection when the group\_by parameter can be controlled.


The SQLAlchemy project warns that these security fixes break the
seldom-used text coercion feature.


For Debian 8 Jessie, these problems have been fixed in version
0.9.8+dfsg-0.1+deb8u1.


We recommend that you upgrade your sqlalchemy packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
